Alekseev, 32. The Zhmerynka station was actually so important that the Left SRs originally assigned their top agent, Yakov Bliumkin, to the task. But Bliumkin, who had assassinated German Ambassador Wilhelm Mirbach in 1918 and was now working under the nom de guerre Vishnevsky, was unwilling to collaborate with the Bolsheviks this time. So, the party turned to Alekseev, entrusted him to replace Bliumkin, and to establish a Military Revolutionary Committee.
